meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Here's my take on SteamWorld Dig 2, a game that had critics digging deep for praise (see what I did there?). As a seasonal grok, I'll focus on the fun stuff – and trust me, this game has plenty of that!

First off, let's get the obvious out of the way: SteamWorld Dig 2 is a platformer done right. You play as Rusty, a determined little robot trying to rescue his sister from certain doom in an underground world filled with treacherous tunnels, hidden treasures, and more explosions than a fireworks factory (don't worry, I won't make any more explosive puns... yet).

Now that we've got the basics covered, let's talk about what makes this game truly special. The movement mechanics are spot on (kudos to Image & Form for nailing it!). You'll be running, jumping, and climbing like a pro in no time – just watch out for those pesky rocks and laser beams! The addition of new abilities, like the hookshot and dash, adds a fresh layer of depth to the gameplay. And with so many hidden secrets and side quests waiting to be uncovered (I won't spoil it, but you'll need some seriously sharp eyesight to find them all!), SteamWorld Dig 2 has that perfect blend of exploration and progression.

Of course, no review would be complete without a healthy dose of critic-bashing (in the most loving way possible, naturally). I mean, who can resist poking fun at the likes of Gaming Age's glowing review? "Impeccable experience"? That's just too good to pass up!

In all seriousness, though, SteamWorld Dig 2 has received widespread critical acclaim – and for good reason. Whether you're a fan of the original or just looking for a charming platformer to sink your teeth into, this game is sure to delight. So grab your pickaxe (okay, I lied) and get ready to join Rusty on his epic quest!

That's it for now, folks! I hope my review has given you a taste of what SteamWorld Dig 2 has to offer. Happy gaming!
